title: Example configuration for low reads, high writes (5 read/500 write requests per second)
content:
api:
  replicas: 6
  resources:
    requests:
      cpu: "1"
      memory: "2Gi"
    limits:
      cpu: "2"
      memory: "4Gi"

queue:
  replicas: 10
  resources:
    requests:
      cpu: "1"
      memory: "2Gi"
    limits:
      cpu: "2"
      memory: "4Gi"

config:
  numberOfJobsPerWorker: 50

redis:
  resources:
    requests:
      memory: "2Gi"
    limits:
      memory: "2Gi"

postgres:
  resources:
    requests:
      cpu: "4"
      memory: "16Gi"
    limits:
      cpu: "8"
      memory: "32Gi"
yaml  theme={null}

code_samples.code:
### High reads, low writes <a name="high-reads-low-writes" />

You have a high volume of read requests (500 per second) but relatively few write requests (5 per second).

For this, we recommend a configuration like this:
